page.title: 03HUMSHAUGH FARMING TODAY

THE YIELDS OF WHEAT HAVE INCREASED FROM AN AVERAGE OF 2 TONS PER ACRE TO ALMOST 4 TONS OVER THE PAST 10 YEARS, THE SELLING PRICE BEING ABOUT Â£100 PER TON. HORMONES AND STEROIDS ARE OFTEN USED TO MAXIMISE EFFICIENCY IN BEEF PRODUCTION; AN AVERAGE 500 KILO STEER WOULD REALISE Â£500. IT IS BECOMING APPARENT THAT EUROPEAN COUNTRIES WITHIN THE EEC WERE OVER PRODUCING AND THERE ARE MASSIVE STOCKS OF{CEREALS,} {DAIRY PRODUCE}AND{MEAT.} IT APPEARS THAT OVER THE NEXT FEW YEARS FARMING WILL HAVE TO CHANGE TO A LOWER INPUT AND PERHAPS LESS EFFICIENT SYSTEMS TO REDUCE PRODUCTION AND REMAIN VIABLE.
